titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. John W. Baily, Judgment
CWG4973

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Edmonson Circuit Court
May Term 1864
Commonwealth Plff
agst } Keeping a gamin hous
John W Baily Deft

This cause came on for trial and came the Comlth by her atty and the Deft by his atty and announced themselves ready and then came a Jury Towit Edmond Hamilton, Berry Eaton, Samuel Cutliff, Wily Jones, Asel Houchin David Jones, Henry M Mitchell J H Hamilton Wm Howard John Tarter L J Blair Isaac Cross. and after being empannelled and Sworn to well and truly try the issue Joined &c and after hearing the evidence & arguments of the attys retired to their room & after consultation returned into court the following verdict Towit We of the Jury find the deft guilty of the offence as herein charged and assess his punishment at a fine of two hundred dollars

It is therefore ordered and adjudged by the court that the plff recover of the Deft the sum of two hundred dollars and her cost herein expanded and that he make his fine good by the payment
of sd sum and he may be taken &c

A copy Attest
Aran Lawson C E C C
